notesStmt.note: Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano (active 1575-1624): inscribed with his name, 1598 (folio 129v); see William Popper, The Censorship of Hebrew Books (New York: KTAV Publishing House, 1969), p. 61, and appendix § 62-74. Folios 1-2 are a later additions, giving the contents of five manuscripts of Moses Rieti's Miḳdash me῾at. Shelomoh Pogetto: inscribed, folio 3r. Me᾿ir ben Shelomoh Luzzatto: inscribed with his name in a record of purchase of the manuscript from Shelomoh Pogetto, folio 3r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 112: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum: inscribed, folio [140v] (fse001v).
